pageContext.description: Rough casting with collar. A pair of nearly parallel raised lines ending in a pellet decorate each edge of the two faces. Each pair of lines is slightly curved, perhaps in imitation of wings. On one face, between the two pairs of lines, is a circle motif. Iron stain on one face.
pageContext.publications: Ant. Journ. XXVIII (1948), pp. 157-163 and Plate XX, 6.,Sussex N. & Queries Vol. 12, 1, pp. 9-11.
pageContext.site: England,Sussex,Sompting,Hill Barn Nurseries,Discovered by a mechanical excavator at a point 300 feet north-east of Hill Barn, Sompting and 1,500 feet south-west of the south-west edge of Lancing Ring (TQ 176062), October 1846. Five feet deep in an accumulation of brown clayey mould.
pageContext.remarks: From the same mould as No. 3652/5
